metadata.title: CVE-2023-50229 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
BlueZ Phone Book Access Profile Heap-based Buffer Overflow Remote CodeExecution Vulnerability. This vulnerability allows network-adjacentattackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of BlueZ.User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that thetarget must connect to a malicious Bluetooth device. The specific flawexists within the handling of the Phone Book Access profile. The issueresults from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplieddata prior to copying it to a fixed-length heap-based buffer. An attackercan leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root. WasZDI-CAN-20936.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-50229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-cups - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-hcidump - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-meshd - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-obexd - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-source - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-test-scripts - 5.72-0ubuntu5
bluez-test-tools - 5.72-0ubuntu5
libbluetooth3 - 5.72-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.72-0ubuntu5').
